alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Craig (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Alleghany County in west central Virginia, central Craig County in southwestern Virginia, south central Greenbrier, east central Summers and Monroe Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 245 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Alleghany to Gap Mills to Wayside. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... White Sulphur Springs... Union... Paint Bank... Jordan Mines... Laurel Branch... and Craig Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
